The effects of temperature fluctuation remain enigmatic because experimental approaches so far have been restricted to using simplistic thermal profiles, such as uniform sinusoidal cycles or high/low alternating temperatures (Fig. 1a–m). These simplistic experiments do not capture the complexity of the incubation conditions found in nature, where diel fluctuations may not follow a uniform cycle and may include seasonal or sub-seasonal trends (Fig. 1n)
14, 16– 20 . Therefore, research thus far may have obscured the potential for mitigating or exacerbating responses to contemporary climate change that can only be revealed under more realistic experimental conditions.
